summary.para: Adds a security identifier (SID) to the specified boundary descriptor.

param.name: BoundaryDescriptor
param.para: A handle to the boundary descriptor. The function returns this handle.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call .

remarks.para: The AddSIDToBoundaryDescriptor function must be called once for each SID to be added to the boundary descriptor.
To compile an application that uses this function, define _WIN32_WINNT as 0x0600 or later.

param.name: Handle
param.para: The namespace handle. This handle is created by or .

param.name: Flags
param.para: If this parameter is PRIVATE_NAMESPACE_FLAG_DESTROY (0x00000001), the namespace is destroyed.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call .

remarks.para: To compile an application that uses this function, define _WIN32_WINNT as 0x0600 or later.

param.name: lpPrivateNamespaceAttributes
param.para: A pointer to a SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies the security attributes of the namespace object.

param.name: lpBoundaryDescriptor
param.para: A descriptor that defines how the namespace is to be isolated. The caller must be within this boundary. The function creates a boundary descriptor.

param.name: lpAliasPrefix
param.para: The prefix for the namespace. To create an object in this namespace, specify the object name as prefix\objectname.
The system supports multiple private namespaces with the same name, as long as they define different boundaries.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns a handle to the new namespace.
If the function fails, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call .

remarks.para: Other applications can access the namespace using the function.

The application that created the namespace can use the function to close the handle to the namespace. The handle is also closed when the creating process terminates. After the namespace handle is closed, subsequent calls to fail, but all operations on objects in the namespace succeed.
To compile an application that uses this function, define _WIN32_WINNT as 0x0600 or later.

param.name: BoundaryDescriptor
param.para: A handle to the boundary descriptor. The function returns this handle.

remarks.para: To compile an application that uses this function, define _WIN32_WINNT as 0x0600 or later.

param.name: lpBoundaryDescriptor
param.para: A descriptor that defines how the namespace is to be isolated. The function creates a boundary descriptor.

param.name: lpAliasPrefix
param.para: The prefix for the namespace. To create an object in this namespace, specify the object name as prefix\objectname.

returns.para: The function returns the handle to the existing namespace.

remarks.para: To compile an application that uses this function, define _WIN32_WINNT as 0x0600 or later.
